address.street: Urquhart-Dykes & Lord LLP Tower North Central Merrion Way

description.p: The present invention relates to a patella component.

During the lifetime of a patient, it may be necessary to perform a joint replacement procedure on the patient as a result of, for example, disease or trauma. The joint replacement procedure may involve the use of a prosthesis which is implanted into one or more of the patient's bones. In the case of a patella replacement procedure, a orthopaedic prosthesis is implanted into the patient's patella. Specifically, a prosthetic patella component is secured to the patient's natural patella such that its posterior surface articulates with a femoral component during extension and flexion of the knee.

A conventional patella component is embodied as a dome-shaped polymer bearing. Other types of patella components include conforming bearings which attempt to conform with the bearing surfaces of the femur.

US-5871540 discloses a patellar implant component which includes an anterior base portion having a dome portion on its posterior side. The dome portion is offset superiorly relative to a centerline extending laterally across the component.
The invention provides a patella component as defined in claim 1.
The superior edge of the patella component is thicker than its inferior edge.
The patella component may also include medial and lateral edges which are of similar size.
The superior edge of the patella component may be thicker than each of its inferior, medial, and lateral edges.
The inferior edge of the patella component may be of similar size to its medial and lateral edges.
The patella component may be embodied as a monolithic polyethylene body.
The curved peak surface of the patella component is offset in the superior direction from the centre of the superior/inferior width of the component.
The patella component may also include medial and lateral edges which are of similar size.
The superior edge of the patella component may be thicker than the medial edge of the component.
The superior edge may also be thicker than the lateral edge of the patella component.
The superior edge of the patella component is thicker than both the medial and lateral edges of the component.
The posterior bearing surface of the patella component extends away from its curved peak surface in the medial/lateral direction at a steeper angle than it does in the superior/inferior direction.

Terms representing anatomical references, such as anterior, posterior, medial, lateral, superior, inferior, etcetera, may be used throughout this disclosure in reference to both the orthopaedic implants described herein and a patient's natural anatomy. Such terms have well-understood meanings in both the study of anatomy and the field of orthopaedics. Use of such anatomical reference terms in the specification and claims is intended to be consistent with their well-understood meanings unless noted otherwise.

Referring to the drawings, FIGS. 1 to 4 show a patella component 10 of a knee prosthesis. The patella component 10 includes a posterior bearing surface 12 configured to articulate with the natural or prosthetic condyles of the femur. As used herein, unless noted otherwise, the terms "femur" or "femoral" are intended to mean both natural and prosthetic features of a femur. As such, the term "femoral condyles" is intended to cover both natural femoral condyles and prosthetic femoral condyles. The patella component 10 is embodied as a monolithic polymer body constructed with a material that allows for smooth articulation between the patella component 10 and the femur. One such polymeric material is polyethylene such as ultrahigh molecular weight polyethylene (UHMWPE).

The patella component 10 also includes a flat anterior surface 14 having a number of fixation members, such as pegs 16, extending away from it. The pegs 16 are configured to be implanted into a surgically prepared posterior surface of the patient's natural patella (not shown). In such a way, the posterior bearing surface 12 of the patella component 10 faces toward the femur thereby allowing the posterior bearing surface 12 to articulate with the femoral condyles during flexion and extension of the patient's knee.

The posterior bearing surface 12 has a curved peak surface 18. The curved peak surface 18 defines the posterior-most surface of the patella component 10. Specifically, a point on the curved peak surface 18 defines the posterior-most point 20 of the patella component 10. The curved peak surface 18 extends anteriorly from the posterior-most point 20 in the general direction toward the anterior surface 14. In particular, as viewed in FIG. 3, the curved peak surface 18 transitions to a flat inferior surface 22 that extends inferiorly away from the curved peak surface 18. The flat inferior surface 22 in turn transitions to a rounded inferior edge surface 24 that extends inferiorly away from the flat inferior surface 22 in the direction toward the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10. As shown in FIG. 3, the inferior edge surface 24 is embodied as a curved corner surface 26 that transitions from the flat inferior surface 22 to the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10.

As also shown in FIG. 3, the curved peak surface 18 transitions to a flat superior surface 28 that extends superiorly away from the curved peak surface 18. The flat superior surface 28 in turn transitions to a rounded superior edge surface 30 that extends superiorly away from the flat superior surface 28 in the direction toward the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10. The rounded superior edge 30 includes a curved corner surface 32 that transitions to the flat superior surface 28 and a flat surface 34 that transitions the curved corner surface 32 to the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10.

As shown in FIG. 4, the curved peak surface 18 transitions to a flat medial surface 36 that extends medially away from the curved peak surface 18. The flat medial surface 36 transitions to a rounded medial edge surface 38 that extends medially away from the flat medial surface 36 in the direction toward the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10. Similarly, a flat lateral surface 40 extends laterally away from the curved peak surface 18. The flat lateral surface 40 transitions to a rounded lateral edge surface 42 that extends laterally away from the flat lateral surface 40 in the direction toward the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10.

As shown in FIGS. 1 and 3, the curved peak surface 18 of the patella component 10 is offset in the superior direction relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component. Specifically, as can best be seen in FIG. 3, the posterior-most point 20 of the posterior bearing surface 12 is positioned superiorly of the centre of the superior/inferior width of the patella component 10. This is demonstrated geometrically in the superior/inferior cross sectional view of FIG. 3 where a pair of imaginary lines extend through the patella component 10 in the anterior/posterior direction. Specifically, an imaginary line 44 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 through the posterior-most point 20 of the patella component 10, whereas another imaginary line 46 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 through the midpoint 48 of the superior/inferior width of the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10. As can be seen in FIG. 3, the imaginary line 44 extending through the posterior-most point 20 is parallel to the imaginary line 46 extending through the midpoint 48, but is spaced apart from it in the superior direction.

In the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4, offsetting the curved peak surface 18 of the patella component 10 in the superior direction in such a manner results in a thickened superior edge relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of the curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component. Specifically, as can be seen in FIGS. 3 and 4, the superior edge of the patella component 10 is thicker than its inferior, medial, and lateral edges. Because the edges of the patella component 10 are rounded, such a feature can be demonstrated geometrically in a number of different manners. One way to do so is shown in FIGS. 3 and 4 and described below. However, it should be appreciated that the relative thickness of each of the component's edges may be demonstrated geometrically in other ways. As shown herein, the tangent point of the edge's rounded corner serves as a common point of reference for determining the thickness of each edge of the patella component 10. Specifically, an imaginary line 50 extends along the flat inferior surface 22 and defines a tangent point 52 at the transition of the flat inferior surface 22 and the rounded inferior edge surface 24. Another imaginary line 54 extends along the flat superior surface 28 and defines a second tangent point 56 at the transition of the flat superior surface 28 and the rounded superior edge surface 30. As can be seen in FIG. 3, an imaginary line segment 58 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 to the tangent point 52, whereas another imaginary line segment 60 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 to the tangent point 56. Because the superior edge of the patella component 10 is thicker than its inferior edge, the imaginary line segment 60 is longer than the imaginary line segment 58.

As shown in FIG. 4, an imaginary line 62 extends along the flat medial surface 36 and defines a tangent point 64 at the transition of the flat medial surface 36 and the rounded medial edge surface 38. Another imaginary line 66 extends along the flat lateral surface 40 and defines a tangent point 68 at the transition of the flat lateral surface 40 and the rounded lateral edge surface 42. An imaginary line segment 70 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 to the tangent point 64, whereas an imaginary line segment 72 extends orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 10 to the tangent point 68. Because the medial and lateral edges are similar in size, the imaginary line segment 70 is equal in length to the imaginary line segment 72.

In the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4, the superior edge is the thickest edge of the patella component 10. As such, the imaginary line segment 60 is longer than each of the imaginary line segment 58, the imaginary line segment 70, and the imaginary line segment 72. Moreover, because the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4 is geometrically constructed by offsetting the curved peak surface 18 of the patella component 10 in the superior direction relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component, the inferior edge is similar in size to the medial and lateral edges of the component 10. In other words, the imaginary line segment 58 is equal in length each of the imaginary line segment 70 and the imaginary line segment 72. It should be appreciated, however, that such need not be the case. For example, it is contemplated that the inferior edge could be thinner than the medial and lateral edges. Moreover, as will be discussed below in greater detail, the inferior edge could be thicker than the medial and lateral edges.

In the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4, the posterior bearing surface 12 extends away from the posterior-most point 20 of the curved peak surface 18 at a similar angle in all directions. This is shown geometrically in FIGS. 3 and 4 in the angles created by the intersection of the imaginary lines extending along the flat surfaces of the posterior bearing surface 12. Specifically, the imaginary line 50 that extends along the flat inferior surface 22 intersects the imaginary line 54 that extends along the flat superior surface 28 to define an angle of intersection (α), whereas, the imaginary line 62 that extends along the flat medial surface 36 intersects the imaginary line 66 that extends along the flat lateral surface 40 to define an angle of intersection (β). In the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4, the angle of intersection (α) is equal to the angle of intersection (β). In other words, the posterior bearing surface 12 extends away from the posterior-most point 20 of the curved peak surface 18 at the same angle in the superior/inferior direction as it does in the medial/lateral direction. Specifically, in the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4, the angles of intersection (α, β) are both approximately 1300. In such an arrangement (i.e., one in which the posterior bearing surface 12 extends away from the curved peak surface 18 at a common angle in each direction), the thickened superior edge of the patella component 10 is created, conceptually, by the "shortening" of the superior side of the component as a result of having an offset peak.

Another embodiment of a patella component 110 is shown in FIGS. 5 to 8. The patella component 110 shares many similarities with the patella component 10. The same reference numerals used utilized in FIGS. 1 to 8 to refer to common structures and features.

Like the patella component 10 of FIGS. 1 to 4, the patella component 110 of FIGS. 5 to 8 has a curved peak surface 18 that is offset in the superior direction relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component. As a result, as can best be seen in FIG. 7, the posterior-most point 20 of the posterior bearing surface 12 is positioned superiorly of the centre of the superior/inferior width of the patella component 110. This is demonstrated geometrically in the superior/inferior cross sectional view of FIG. 7 where the imaginary line 44 extending through the posterior-most point 20 is parallel to the imaginary line 46 extending through the midpoint 48, but is spaced apart from it in the superior direction. In the embodiment shown in FIGS. 5 to 8, the patella component 110 has a greater superior offset relative to the patella component 10. In other words, the distance between the imaginary line 44 and the imaginary line 46 is greater in FIGS. 5 to 8 relative to the embodiment shown in FIGS. 1 to 4. In the embodiments described herein, the magnitude of the superior offset is 3 to 5 mm, but the magnitude of the superior offset may be altered in the either embodiment to fit the needs of a given design of a patella component.

Like the patella component 10, the superior edge of the patella component 110 is thickened relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of the curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component. Specifically, as can be seen in FIGS. 7 and 8, the superior edge of the patella component 110 is thicker than its inferior, medial, and lateral edges. Such a feature can be demonstrated geometrically in a similar manner to as described above in regard to FIGS. 1 to 4, that is, by using the tangent point of the edge's rounded corner as a common point of reference for determining the thickness of each edge of the patella component 110. As described above in detail, the length of imaginary line segments extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the patella component 110 through the respective tangent point of each edge may be used to demonstrate the differences in thickness of the component's edges. Specifically, because the superior edge of the patella component 110 is thicker than its inferior edge, the imaginary line segment 60 is longer than the imaginary line segment 58.

Like the patella component 10, the medial and lateral edges of the patella component 110 are of similar size. As such, the imaginary line segment 70 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 64 is equal in length to the imaginary line segment 72 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 68. However, unlike the patella component 10 in which its inferior edge is similar, or even smaller in size, relative to its medial and lateral edges, the inferior edge of the component 110 is thicker than its medial and lateral edges. As a result, the imaginary line segment 58 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 52 is longer than each of the imaginary line segment 70 and the imaginary line segment 72.

Unlike the patella component 10 in which the posterior bearing surface 12 extends away from the curved peak surface 18 at a common angle in each direction, the posterior bearing surface 12 of the patella component 110 extends away from the curved peak surface 18 in the medial/lateral direction at a steeper angle than it does in the superior/inferior direction. This is shown geometrically in FIGS. 7 and 8 where the angle of intersection (α) formed by the intersection of the imaginary line 50 extending along the flat inferior surface 22 and the imaginary line 54 extending along the flat superior surface 28 is greater than the angle of intersection (β) formed by the intersection of the imaginary line 62 extending along the flat medial surface 36 and the imaginary line 66 extending along the flat lateral surface 40. Specifically, in the embodiment shown FIGS. 5 to 8, the angle of intersection (α) is approximately 152°, whereas the angle of intersection (β) is approximately 130°.

Another embodiment of a patella component 210 is shown in FIGS. 9 to 12. The patella component 210 shares many similarities with the patella components 10, 110. The same reference numerals are used in FIGS. 1 to 12 to refer to common structures and features.

Unlike the patella components 10, 110, the curved peak surface 18 of the patella component 210 is not offset in the superior direction, but rather is similar in design to a conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the tip of curved peak surface (i.e., the posterior-most point) is positioned in the centre of the component. As a result, and as can best be seen in FIG. 11, the posterior-most point 20 of the posterior bearing surface 12 is aligned with the centre of the superior/inferior width of the patella component 210. This is demonstrated geometrically in the superior/inferior cross sectional view of FIG. 11 where the imaginary line 44 extending through the posterior-most point 20 is coincident with the imaginary line 46 extending through the midpoint 48. In other words, the imaginary line 44 and the imaginary line 46 form a common line.

Like the patella components 10, 110, the medial and lateral edges of the patella component 210 are of similar size. Such a feature can be demonstrated geometrically in a similar manner to as described above in regard to FIGS. 1 to 4, that is, by using the tangent point of the edge's rounded corner as a common point of reference for determining the thickness of each edge of the patella component 210. As described above in detail, and not repeated here for purposes of brevity, the length of the imaginary line segment 70 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 64 is equal to the length of the imaginary line segment 72 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 68.

Also like the patella components 10, 110, the superior edge of the patella component 210 is thicker than the component's medial and lateral edges. Specifically, as can be seen in FIGS. 11 and 12, the superior edge of the patella component 210 is thicker than its medial and lateral edges. Because the superior edge of the patella component 210 is thicker than its medial and lateral edges, the imaginary line segment 60 of the patella component 210 is longer than each of the imaginary line segment 70 and the imaginary line segment 72.

However, unlike the patella components 10, 110 which have superior edges that are thicker than their inferior edges, the inferior edge of the component 210 is similar in size to its superior edge. As a result, the length of the imaginary line segment 58 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the component 210 through the tangent point 52 is equal to the length of the imaginary line segment 60 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the component 210 through the tangent point 56. In such an arrangement, both the superior edge and the inferior edge of the patella component 210 are thicker than either of its medial and lateral edges. In other words, both the imaginary line segment 58 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the component 210 through the tangent point 52 and the imaginary line segment 60 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 of the component 210 through the tangent point 56 are longer than both the imaginary line segment 70 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 64 and the imaginary line segment 72 extending orthogonally from the anterior surface 14 through the tangent point 68.

Like the patella component 110, the posterior bearing surface 12 of the patella component 210 extends away from the curved peak surface 18 in the medial/lateral direction at a steeper angle than it does in the superior/inferior direction. Specifically, as shown geometrically in FIGS. 11 and 12, the angle of intersection (α) formed by the intersection of the imaginary line 50 extending along the flat inferior surface 22 and the imaginary line 54 extending along the flat superior surface 28 is greater than the angle of intersection (β) formed by the intersection of the imaginary line 62 extending along the flat medial surface 36 and the imaginary line 66 extending along the flat lateral surface 40. Specifically, in the embodiment shown in FIGS. 9 to 12, the angle of intersection (α) is approximately 152°, whereas the angle of intersection (β) is approximately 130°.

Numerous embodiments of patella components have been described herein. Each of such embodiments includes a superior edge which has been thickened relative to the design of conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the superior edge shares a common size with the component's remaining edges. Certain of the embodiments of the patella components described herein also include inferior edges that are thicker than the medial and lateral edges of the component. Certain of the embodiments of the patella components described herein also include a posterior bearing surface in which the curved peak surface thereof is offset in the superior direction relative to conventional dome-shaped patella components. It should be appreciated that the dimensional magnitude of such features may be varied to fit the needs of a given design of a patella component. In particular, a given design of a patella component is typically made commercially available in a variety of different sizes, particularly in a variety of different lengths and widths. This is done to accommodate the many variations in patient size and anatomy across a population. As such, the dimensions of a given design of the patella components 10, 110, 210, including the thickness of a given edge or the magnitude of the offset of the curved peak surface, may also be varied to accommodate such variations in patient size and anatomy across a population.

Features of the various embodiments described above may also be combined as needed to fit the design of a given patella component. For example, patella components having medial and lateral edges with differing thicknesses may be utilized. As a further example, a patella component having a centred curved peak surface (e.g., in a similar manner to the patella component 210) may be embodied with a superior edge that is thicker than its inferior edge (e.g., in a similar manner to the patella components 10, 110).

Each of the patella components described herein includes a superior edge which has been thickened relative to the design of conventional dome-shaped patella components in which the superior edge shares a common size with the component's remaining edges. Unexpectedly, such a design helps resist the tendency of the patella component to extend during deep flexion of the knee. Moreover, such a design has also unexpectedly contributed to a reduction in polymer deformation on the superior edge of the patella component.

claim.claim-text:
Patellakomponente (10) mit (i) einer posterioren Lagerfläche (12), die konfiguriert ist, um mit den Femurkondylen eines Femurs gelenkig verbunden zu sein, und (ii) einer anterioren Fläche (14) mit einer Anzahl von Stiften (16), die sich davon nach außen erstrecken,
wobei bei Betrachtung in Querschnittsansicht in der superioren/inferioren Richtung, die posteriore Lagerfläche (i) eine Fläche (18) mit abgerundeter Spitze, die die hinterste Fläche der Partellakomponte definiert und relativ zum Mittelpunkt der superioren/inferioren Breite der Komponente superior versetzt ist, (ii) eine flache inferiore Fläche (22), die sich von der Fläche mit abgerundeter Spitze inferior wegerstreckt, und (iii) eine flache superiore Fläche (28) aufweist, die sich von der Fläche mit abgerundeter Spitze superior weg erstreckt,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die posteriore Lagerfläche eine abgerundete inferiore Randfläche (24), die sich von der flachen inferioren Fläche in der Richtung zur antererioren Fläche der Partellakomponte inferior weg erstreckt, und eine abgerundete superiore Randfläche (30) aufweist, die sich von der flachen superioren Fläche in der Richtung zur anterioren Fläche der Partellakomponente superior weg erstreckt, wobei (i) sich eine erste imaginäre Linie (50) entlang der flachen inferioren Fläche erstreckt und einen ersten Berührungspunkt (52) am Übergang der flachen inferioren Fläche und der abgerundeten inferioren Randfläche definiert, (ii) sich eine zweite imaginäre Linie (54) entlang der flachen superioren Fläche erstreckt und einen zweiten Berührungspunkt (56) am Übergang der flachen superioren Fläche und der abgerundeten superioren Randfläche definiert, (iii) sich ein erstes imaginäres Liniensegment (58) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche der Partellakomponente zum ersten Berührungspunkt erstreckt, (iv) sich ein zweites imaginäres Liniensegment (60) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche der Partellakomponente zum zweiten Berührungspunkt erstreckt und (v) das zweite imaginäre Liniensegment länger als das erste imaginäre Liniensegment ist.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 1, wobei die abgerundete superiore Randfläche (30) (i) eine gekrümmte Eckfläche (32), die mit der flachen superioren Fläche (28) verbunden ist, und (ii) eine flache Fläche (34) aufweist, die die gekrümmte Eckfläche mit der anterioren Fläche (14) der Patellakomponente (10) verbindet.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 1, wobei: bei Betrachtung in einer Querschnittsansicht in der medialen/lateralen Richtung die posteriore Lagerfläche (12) (i) eine flache mediale Fläche (36), die sich von der Fläche (18) mit abgerundeter Spitze medial weg erstreckt, (ii) eine abgerundete mediale Randfläche (38), die sich von der flachen medialen Fläche in der Richtung zur anterioren Fläche (14) der Partellakomponente (10) medial wegerstreckt, (iii) eine flache laterale Fläche (40), die sich von der Fläche mit abgerundeter Spitze lateral weg erstreckt, und (iv) eine abgerundete laterale Randfläche (42) aufweist, die sich von der flachen lateralen Fläche in der Richtung zur anterioren Fläche der Partellakomponente lateral weg erstreckt, und wobei (i) sich eine dritte imaginäre Linie (62) entlang der flachen medialen Fläche erstreckt und einen dritten Berührungspunkt (64) am Übergang der flachen medialen Fläche und der abgerundeten medialen Randfläche definiert, (ii) sich eine vierte imaginäre Linie (66) entlang der flachen lateralen Fläche erstreckt und einen vierten Berührungspunkt (68) am Übergang der flachen lateralen Fläche und der abgerundeten lateralen Randfläche definiert, (iii) sich ein drittes imaginäres Liniensegment (70) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche der Patellakomponente zum dritten Berührungspunkt erstreckt, (iv) sich ein viertes imaginäres Liniensegment (72) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche der Patellakomponente zum vierten Berührungspunkt erstreckt, und (v) die Länge des dritten imaginären Liniensegments derjenigen des vierten imaginären Liniensegments entspricht.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 3, wobei das zweite imaginäre Liniensegment (60) länger als jedes des ersten imaginären Liniensegments (58), des dritten imaginären Liniensegments (70) und des vierten imaginären Liniensegments (72) ist.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 3, wobei die Länge des ersten imaginären Liniensegments (58) geringer als die oder gleich der Länge jedes des dritten imaginären Liniensegments (70) und des vierten imaginären Liniensegments (72) ist.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 3, wobei der Schnittwinkel (α), der durch das Schneiden der ersten imaginären Linie (50), die sich entlang der flachen inferioren Fläche (22) erstreckt, und der zweiten imaginären Linie (54), die sich entlang der flachen superioren Fläche (28) erstreckt, größer als der Schnittwinkel (β) ist, der durch das Schneiden der dritten imaginären Linie (62), die sich entlang der flachen medialen Fläche (36) erstreckt, und der vierten imaginären Linie (66) gebildet wird, die sich entlang der flachen lateralen Fläche (40) erstreckt.
Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 1, die einen monolitischen Polyethylenkörper (10) aufweist.

Patellakomponente nach Anspruch 1, wobei: ein Punkt (20) auf der Fläche mit abgerundeter Spitze den hintersten Punkt der Partellakomponente (10) definiert, sich eine dritte imaginäre Linie (44) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche (14) der Patellakomponte durch den hintersten Punkt der Patellakomponente erstreckt, sich eine vierte imaginäre Linie (46) orthogonal von der anterioren Fläche der Patellakomponte durch den Mittelpunkt (48) der superioren/inferioren Breite der anterioren Fläche der Patellakomponente erstreckt, und die dritte imaginäre Linie parallel zur vierten imaginären Linie verläuft und davon superior im Abstand angeordnet ist.

A patella component (10) having (i) a posterior bearing surface (12) configured to articulate with the femoral condyles of a femur, and (ii) an anterior surface (14) having a number of pegs (16) extending outwardly from it,
in which, when viewed in a cross sectional view taken in the superior/inferior direction, the posterior bearing surface has (i) a curved peak surface (18) which defines the posterior-most surface of the patella component and which is offset superiorly relative to the centre of the superior/inferior width of the component, (ii) a flat inferior surface (22) which extends inferiorly away from the curved peak surface, (iii) a flat superior surface (28) which extends superiorly away from the curved peak surface,
characterised in that the posterior bearing surface has a rounded inferior edge surface (24) which extends inferiorly away from the flat inferior surface in the direction toward the anterior surface of the patella component, and a rounded superior edge surface (30) which extends superiorly away from the flat superior surface in the direction toward the anterior surface of the patella component, in which (i) a first imaginary line (50) extends along the flat inferior surface and defines a first tangent point (52) at the transition of the flat inferior surface and the rounded inferior edge surface, (ii) a second imaginary line (54) extends along the flat superior surface and defines a second tangent point (56) at the transition of the flat superior surface and the rounded superior edge surface, (iii) a first imaginary line segment (58) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface of the patella component to the first tangent point, (iv) a second imaginary line segment (60) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface of the patella component to the second tangent point, and (v) the second imaginary line segment is longer than the first imaginary line segment.

The patella component of claim 1, in which the rounded superior edge surface (30) comprises (i) a curved corner surface (32) connected to the flat superior surface (28), and (ii) a flat surface (34) which connects the curved corner surface to the anterior surface (14) of the patella component (10).

The patella component of clam 1, in which: when viewed in a cross sectional view taken in the medial/lateral direction, the posterior bearing surface (12) has (i) a flat medial surface (36) which extends medially away from the curved peak surface (18), (ii) a rounded medial edge surface (38) which extends medially away from the flat medial surface in the direction toward the anterior surface (14) of the patella component (10), (iii) a flat lateral surface (40) which extends laterally away from the curved peak surface, and (iv) a rounded lateral edge surface (42) which extends laterally away from the flat lateral surface in the direction toward the anterior surface of the patella component, and in which (i) a third imaginary line (62) extends along the flat medial surface and defines a third tangent point (64) at the transition of the flat medial surface and the rounded medial edge surface, (ii) a fourth imaginary line (66) extends along the flat lateral surface and defines a fourth tangent point (68) at the transition of the flat lateral surface and the rounded lateral edge surface, (iii) a third imaginary line segment (70) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface of the patella component to the third tangent point, (iv) a fourth imaginary line segment (72) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface of the patella component to the fourth tangent point, and (v) the third imaginary line segment is equal in length to the fourth imaginary line segment.

The patella component of claim 3, in which the second imaginary line segment (60) is longer than each of the first imaginary line segment (58), the third imaginary line segment (70), and the fourth imaginary line segment (72).

The patella component of claim 3, in which the length of the first imaginary line segment (58) is less than or equal to the length of each of the third imaginary line segment (70) and the fourth imaginary line segment (72).

The patella component of claim 3, in which the angle of intersection (α) formed by the intersection of the first imaginary line (50) which extends along the flat inferior surface (22) and the second imaginary line (54) which extends along the flat superior surface (28) is greater than the angle of intersection (β) formed by the intersection of the third imaginary line (62) which extends along the flat medial surface (36) and the fourth imaginary line (66) which extends along the flat lateral surface (40).
The patella component of claim 1, which comprises a monolithic polyethylene body (10).

The patella component of claim 1, in which: a point (20) on the curved peak surface defines the posterior-most point of the patella component (10), a third imaginary line (44) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface (14) of the patella component through the posterior-most point of the patella component, a fourth imaginary line (46) extends orthogonally from the anterior surface of the patella component through the midpoint (48) of the superior/inferior width of the anterior surface of the patella component, and the third imaginary line is parallel to, and superiorly spaced apart from, the fourth imaginary line.

Composant de rotule (10) ayant (i) une surface de support postérieure (12) configurée pour l'articulation avec les condyles fémoraux d'un fémur, et (ii) une surface antérieure (14) ayant un nombre de chevilles (16) s'étendant vers l'extérieur depuis celle-ci,
dans lequel, vue en section transversale dans la direction supérieure/inférieure, la surface de support postérieure présente (i) une surface de crête courbée (18) qui définit la surface la plus postérieure du composant de rotule et qui est décalée supérieurement relativement au centre de la largueur supérieure/inférieure du composant, (ii) une surface inférieure plate (22) qui s'étend inférieurement au loin de la surface de crête courbée, (iii) une surface supérieure plate (28) qui s'étend supérieurement au loin de la surface de crête courbée,
caractérisé en ce que la surface de support postérieure possède une surface de bord inférieur arrondie (24) qui s'étend inférieurement au loin de la surface inférieure plate dans la direction vers la surface antérieure du composant de rotule, et une surface de bord supérieur arrondie (30) qui s'étend supérieurement au loin de la surface supérieure plate dans la direction vers la surface antérieure du composant de rotule, où (i) une première ligne imaginaire (50) s'étend le long de la surface inférieure plate et définit un premier point de tangente (52) à la transition de la surface inférieure plate et la surface de bord inférieur arrondie, (ii) une deuxième ligne imaginaire (54) s'étend le long de la surface supérieure plate et définit un deuxième point de tangente (56) à la transition de la surface supérieure plate et de la surface de bord supérieur arrondie, (iii) un première segment de ligne imaginaire (58) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule au premier point de tangente, (iv) un deuxième segment de ligne imaginaire (60) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule au deuxième point de tangente, et (v) le deuxième segment de ligne imaginaire est plus long que le premier segment de ligne imaginaire.

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 1, où la surface de bord supérieur arrondie (30) comprend (i) une surface de coin courbée (32) connectée à la surface supérieure plate (28), et (ii) une surface plate (34) qui connecte la surface de coin courbe à la surface antérieure (14) du composant de rotule (10).

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 1, dans lequel : lorsqu'elle est vue en une vue en section transversale dans la direction médiale/latérale, la surface de support postérieure (12) présente (i) une surface médiale plate (36) qui s'étend médialement au loin de la surface de crête courbée (18), (ii) une surface de bord médial arrondie (38) qui s'étend médialement au loin de la surface médiale plate dans la direction vers la surface antérieure (14) du composant de rotule (10), (iii) une surface latérale plate (40) qui s'étend latéralement au loin de la surface de crête courbée, et (iv) une surface de bord latéral arrondie (42) qui s'étend latéralement au loin de la surface latérale plate dans la direction vers la surface antérieure du composant de rotule, et dans lequel (i) une troisième ligne imaginaire (62) s'étend le long de la surface médiale plate et définit un troisième point de tangente (64) à la transition de la surface médiale plate et de la surface de bord médial arrondie, (ii) une quatrième ligne imaginaire (66) s'étend le long de la surface latérale plate et définit un quatrième point de tangente (68) à la transition de la surface latérale plate et de la surface de bord latéral arrondie, (iii) un troisième segment de ligne imaginaire (70) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule au troisième point de tangente, (iv) un quatrième segment de ligne imaginaire (72) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule au quatrième point de tangente, et (v) le troisième segment de ligne imaginaire est égal en longueur au quatrième segment de ligne imaginaire.

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 3, dans lequel le deuxième segment de ligne imaginaire (60) est plus long que chacun du premier segment de ligne imaginaire (58), du troisième segment de ligne imaginaire (70) et du quatrième segment de ligne imaginaire (72).

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 3, dans lequel la longueur du premier segment de ligne imaginaire (58) est inférieure ou égale à la longueur de chacun du troisième segment de ligne imaginaire (70) et du quatrième segment de ligne imaginaire (72).

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 3, dans lequel l'angle d'intersection (a) formé par l'intersection de la première ligne imaginaire (50) qui s'étend le long de la surface inférieure plate (22) et la deuxième ligne imaginaire (54) qui s'étend le long de la surface supérieure plate (28) est plus grand que l'angle d'intersection (β) formé par l'intersection de la troisième ligne imaginaire (62) qui s'étend le long de la surface médiale plate (36) et la quatrième ligne imaginaire (66) qui s'étend le long de la surface latérale plate (40).
Composant de rotule selon la revendication 1, qui comprend un corps en polyéthylène monolithique (10).

Composant de rotule selon la revendication 1, dans lequel : un point (20) sur la surface de crête courbée définit le point le plus postérieur du composant de rotule (10), une troisième ligne imaginaire (44) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure (14) du composant de rotule à travers le point le plus postérieur du composant de rotule, une quatrième ligne imaginaire (46) s'étend orthogonalement de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule à travers le point médian (48) de la largueur supérieure/inférieure de la surface antérieure du composant de rotule, et la troisième ligne imaginaire est parallèle à, et espacée supérieurement de la quatrième ligne imaginaire.
